title: Are there any startup meetups in Bangalore? - Quora
tags: Startup Advice and Strategy in India

response.answer_text: You can check out Meetup - We are what we do, Eventbrite, Townscript - Upcoming Events in Tickets Today, This Weekend & Month, and Eventshigh - Events & Activities in Bangalore, Today, This Weekend and Upcoming - Events High for regular event updates. These are the good ones. Apart from these, you can also check out some startup communities and event organizers like Pushstart, and Main Home - HelloMeets. I check out these sites every Tuesday to pick out the event for the week. I have been attending events regularly for the last 3+ years. The no of events happening had increased to a large extent over the last 12 months. It's always important to qualify the events that you attend. The objective should be very clear about why and what event you want to attend. Over the years I have tried and validated events to some extent and attend only those that I feel might be valuable in terms of both learning and networking. I had to find those by attending each and every event that comes my way for months. Now I just pick and choose just 2/3 events that I need to attend in a month. Some of the metrics I use are as follows: If the event is happening in a coworking space, especially the premium ones’ the chances of a large gathering is very high - good for networkingBe careful with the topic of the event - that way you can understand what type of audience will be attending as well as the knowledge that you can gather from the event apart from networkingCheck out the speakers and their qualification - you can learn from their experience as well as an opportunity to be connected with themPaid events are really good, - But need to be qualified based on the organizer, speakers, topic and the venue.Hope this will be useful for you to get started. All the very best.

Bangalore is the startup capital of India owing to the fact that a significant proportion of crowd works in startups and the significant other wants to get into startups! Lot of meetups, seminars and networking events keep happening in Bangalore on periodic basis. Sometimes the paid meetups organized by prominent organizations like YourStory, NextBigWhat and likes can be found here: Business Events in Bangalore TiE is an authority in giving some of the best sessions on business knowledge followed by core networking sessions.  You can find their calendar here: TiE Bangalore Calendar However, by far the best startup meet is conducted by 4Stratups, An Initiative of NSRCEL@IIMB " at a place which happens to be the Mecca for businesses: IIM Bangalore.  This startup meet is conducted on first Saturday of every month. Every sessions attracts roughly 150-200 aspiring entrepreneurs/students.  Each session has a set topic and a renowned speaker. Topics like "Funding for startups", "ESOPs for Startups", "Marketing for startups" and the likes are covered.  You should attend the startup meet for March. Just register on the website and they will send you the notification via mail.

Way to many !!!! Try meetup .com and you'll find all the startup events happening in and around Bengaluru (Atleast most of them).  Some of the most prominent ones there are  Bhive, Bootstrap at breakfast, Lounge47, Microsoft ventures and so on. Other means of finding meetups are through ticketing platforms like explara, meraevents, buzzintown. Above are the officially announced ones. You could join FB groups like Bangalore startup connect, Bangalore startups, startup talky, Travel tourism and food startups (TTFS) for random meets are planned over discussions.

You could look up meetup .com and find an appropriate one. I saw a recurring meeting or two for startups there. A few startups might host a meeting. A few other seminars/conferences related to fundraising or startups may be posted there. So then you know where to meet related people. You need to keep an eye on the calendar of events there.

Yes there are plenty of meet up regularly @diffrent place u can find them in meet up. Com.  There are different groups meet up for ex  Startup investors meet upStart up employees meet upTax and registration meet up And list goes on
